info.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued December 21 at 3:26AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Hard Freeze Watch, prolonged subfreezing temperatures are expected. Temperatures will remain below freezing for up to 36 to 46 hours with overnight lows below 15 across these counties during that time period. * WHERE...Houston and Madison Counties. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 8 AM CST this morning. For the Hard Freeze Watch, from Thursday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
